intro: Homalobus humilis, commonly known as the dwarf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth.
